intro: Restio squarrosus, commonly known as the squarrosus restio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family, which includes many grass-like plants found in coastal and mountainous regions. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal dunes or fynbos vegetation. Restio squarrosus is adapted to arid conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
